definitions.definition: A period of time devoted to a particular activity .
examples: "Are we having a recording session ?" / "Yes. We've even got some session musicians to provide some brass."

definitions.definition: An official meeting or term of a council , court , or other body to conduct its business; e.g. the annual or semiannual periods of a legislature (that together comprise the legislative term), whose individual meetings are also called sessions.
examples: This court is now in session .

definitions.definition: The sequence of interactions between client and server , or between user and system ; the period during which a user is logged in or connected .
examples: Logging out or shutting down the computer will end your session .

definitions.definition: Any of the three scheduled two-hour playing sessions, from the start of play to lunch , from lunch to tea and from tea to the close of play.
The act of sitting , or the state of being seated .
Ellipsis of jam session , used in isolate particularly for folk music .
An academic term ; semester ; school year .
An extended period of drinking, typically consuming beer with low alcohol content.
The ruling body of a congregation , consisting of the pastor and elders .

main_definition: A period of time devoted to a particular activity .
secondary_definitions: An official meeting or term of a council , court , or other body to conduct its business; e.g. the annual or semiannual periods of a legislature (that together comprise the legislative term), whose individual meetings are also called sessions.
( computing ) The sequence of interactions between client and server , or between user and system ; the period during which a user is logged in or connected .
( cricket ) Any of the three scheduled two-hour playing sessions, from the start of play to lunch , from lunch to tea and from tea to the close of play.
( chiefly obsolete or theology ) The act of sitting , or the state of being seated .
( music ) Ellipsis of jam session , used in isolate particularly for folk music .
( education ) An academic term ; semester ; school year .
( beer ) An extended period of drinking, typically consuming beer with low alcohol content.
( Presbyterianism ) The ruling body of a congregation , consisting of the pastor and elders .
